alert.note: Alert for Iredell; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 5:52AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Iredell and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas near N Second Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated rapidly rising river stage due to earlier heavy rainfall. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - At 545 AM EDT, the gauge above Statesville Boulevard near Woodleaf was reporting a stage of 12ft (action stage) and still rising quickly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mooresville, Mount Ulla and Piedmont Research Station. Low-water crossings along White Road, Lyerly Road, Upright Road, Graham Road, Hall Road, Childers Road, and Bear Poplar Road will begin to flood as river stage continues to rise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
